docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Not enough is being done to assure that $200 million allocated for drug education last year is being used to establish effective programs in primary and secondary schools. Research indicates that the wrong type of curriculum can be ineffective or even harmful.

headline.main: U.S. Drug 'Crusade' Is Seen as Undermining Itself

docs.snippet: LEAD: Not enough is being done to assure that $200 million allocated for drug education last year is being used to establish effective programs in primary and secondary schools. Research indicates that the wrong type of curriculum can be ineffective...

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Weeks This Last On Week Fiction Week List 1 KALEIDOSCOPE, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, 1 $18.95.) Three sisters, separated by fate, and the lawyer whose mission is to find and reunite them. 2 PRESUMED INNOCENT, by Scott Turow. 1 18 (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $18.95.) A brutal murder creates a crisis among a big city's politicians and lawyers.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A panel of Federal health experts is recommending a wide range of new steps to combat the AIDS epidemic and to provide health care for its victims.

headline.main: NEW STEPS URGED TO HELP CURB AIDS

docs.snippet: LEAD: A panel of Federal health experts is recommending a wide range of new steps to combat the AIDS epidemic and to provide health care for its victims.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR, Special to the New York Times
